meanings.definition: A short description or promotional piece about a book, movie, or product.
meanings.sent1: The blurb on the back of the book gave a brief summary of the story.
meanings.sent2: I always read the blurb on the movie poster before deciding to watch it.
meanings.sent3: The blurb on the cereal box made me laugh with its exaggerated claims.
meanings.sent4: Her blurb about the new product was so captivating, it made everyone curious.
meanings.sent5: The blurb on the advertisement made the product sound irresistible.

meanings.definition: To write or provide a blurb for something.
meanings.sent1: She was asked to blurb the new novel for the author's website.
meanings.sent2: Authors often blurb each other's books to help with promotion.
meanings.sent3: I blurb about my own cooking skills to make my friends smile.
meanings.sent4: He can blurb about any topic with such enthusiasm that it's contagious.
meanings.sent5: The company hired her to blurb about their latest technology in the press release.
